questions.skill: Analyzing how figurative language impacts meaning.
questions.stimulus: (1) The attic door groaned like a grumpy old man waking from a nap. (2) "Go on up, Mia," Grandpa said, his voice a warm blanket. (3) Mia looked up into the darkness. (4) The stairs were a steep mountain, and she felt like a tiny explorer. (5) When she finally poked her head into the attic, her jaw dropped. (6) There were a million boxes stacked to the ceiling. (7) Large dust bunnies skittered away from the light. (8) Sunlight streamed through a single, circular window, cutting a golden sword through the dusty air. (9) Old furniture slept under white sheets, looking like a silent gathering of ghosts. (10) "Wow," Mia whispered. (11) In one corner, an old record player sat, its horn a giant, silent flower. (12) "This place is a time capsule," she said, running her fingers over a wooden chest. (13) "It's been waiting forever for someone to visit." (14) Grandpa chuckled. (15) "Well, the treasures are all yours to discover."
questions.stem: In sentence 1, what does the simile "groaned like a grumpy old man waking from a nap" mean?
options: The door was very old and valuable.
The door made a low, complaining sound when it opened.
An old man was hiding behind the door.
The door was telling Mia to go away.
